column4: hi, im having a few problems with ubuntu! i like it a lot BUT i cant gain root access, and i followed this link to learn how to: http://www.ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-31053.html and also I cant get my wireless usb to work, i typed lspci but it didnt show that device
lspci is not for usb devices. try lsusb instead.
i will try that thanks!
sudo asks for your user password (the one you already used to log in)
first you have to make sure, you card is supported at all. not every usb wireless card is.
which vendor/product ID?
there are two 4-digit numbers separated by a colon
where?
in the lsusb output
sorry! ill be right back and write that down
seems like it works with the at76c503 driver
i don't know if this driver is in ubuntu linux (don't have a test system here right now)
awesome! is there a good tutorial on how to set this up so i can configure it?

first try to find out if this driver is already on your system. if not, try to search in synaptic if it is installable from the repository. at a last resort, you can try compiling the driver from source (kinda hard for a newbie)
the source is here: http://at76c503a.berlios.de/
you need the sources of your running kernel to compile the driver (they are installable with synaptic or apt-get)
i just saw the at76c503 driver already is in ubuntu
does iwconfig report a wireless interface?
ill tell you in a seccond! two different pc's on two different floors!
oh, okay
lsusb just reports the connected usb devices. says nothing about supported devices.
it's a problem for you :))
